meanings.definition: Resembling or characteristic of a state of drowsiness or light hypnosis.
meanings.sent1: The soft music created a hypnoidal atmosphere in the room.
meanings.sent2: The dim lighting gave the room a hypnoidal feel.
meanings.sent3: The hypnoidal effect of the gentle lullaby made everyone yawn.
meanings.sent4: The flickering candlelight cast a hypnoidal spell over the cozy space.
meanings.sent5: The repetitive sound of the ticking clock had a hypnoidal effect on her mind.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to a state of consciousness between wakefulness and sleep.
meanings.sent1: The dreamy state she was in felt hypnoidal.
meanings.sent2: His mind wandered in a hypnoidal haze before falling asleep.
meanings.sent3: The hypnoidal state made him believe he was flying in his dreams.
meanings.sent4: The misty morning fog created a hypnoidal world around him.
meanings.sent5: The soft, muffled sounds of the night were hypnoidal whispers to her ears.
